intro: Rubovietnamia nonggangensis, commonly known as the Nonggang rubovietnamia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Guangxi region of China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests, where it thrives in the understory. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
